  • Field Details

    • PTZ_THRESH

      protected static final float PTZ_THRESH
      Absolute value of PTZ movement threshold. PTZ vectors below this value will be considered as stop commands.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • getCommand

      protected abstract byte[] getCommand() throws IOException

    • getPanTiltSpeedByte

      protected byte getPanTiltSpeedByte(float speed)
      Calculate the pan/tilt "speed byte" that corresponds to the given speed value [-1..1].
      Parameters:
      speed - The speed value [-1..1]. Values outside this range will be remapped.
      Returns:
      The pan/tilt speed byte [0x31..0x3f] corresponding to the given speed value. Note that 0x00 will not be returned, as it seems to be a special, undocumented case (as of v6.8 of the Cohu PTZ protocol specs) that appears to correspond to some sort of "default" speed mode.

    • getZoomSpeedByte

      protected byte getZoomSpeedByte(float speed)
      Calculate the zoom "speed byte" that corresponds to the given speed value [-1..1].
      Parameters:
      speed - The speed value [-1..1]. Values outside this range will be remapped.
      Returns:
      The zoom speed byte [0x30..0x32] corresponding to the given speed value.

    • getPresetByte

      protected byte getPresetByte(int p) throws ProtocolException
      Calculate the "preset byte" that corresponds to the given preset number. Presets [1..47] correspond to preset bytes [0x10..0x3e], and presets [48..64] correspond to preset bytes [0x60..0x70].
      Parameters:
      p - The preset number, [1..64].
      Returns:
      The preset byte corresponding to the given preset number.
      Throws:
      ProtocolException - if the given preset number is invalid.
